entry.title: Combined summary - Version bytes
entry.summary: Pieter Wuille initiated a discussion on IRC to standardize the version bytes used by Bitcoin for several applications. There are three components that seem meaningful: network, data class, and version. Pieter suggests reserving bit 16 in the version byte for "alternate chain" since Namecoin already uses version byte 52 for addresses. When bit 16 isn't set, then remains the rest of the network, and testnet already uses version 111, so Pieter suggests using bit 1 for testnet and if bit 1 is set, XOR the rest of the version number with 111. In full, bits 128/64/32 define data class, bit 16 defines "private", bits 8/4/2 define version number, and bit 1 defines testnet. The whole discussion started when Stefan wanted to define a format for master keys from which to derive deterministic wallet keys, and Pieter suggested using data class 192 for that.
